name: Pahsiv
desc: A protector of the Erinnyes Forest. Although she looks like a Melusine, her kind is a mystery.

customize.text: Although the protector of the Erinnyes forest looks like a Melusine, she has never been to Merusea Village or the Court of Fontaine. One day she met a "visitor" (presumably Neuvillette), and he taught her the language and asked her to defend the island. She learned to say "Melusine" as "no," and "Pahsiv" as "yes," so Paimon named her Pahsiv. All of Erinnyes is the information system of that visitor, through which he can sense changes in the water veins.

Before the filth took over, the weeping willow near the lake collected information, the fog processed it, and the Loch Urania spring sent it. When the filth began to destroy the roots of the weeping willow connecting the water veins, Pahsiv turned for help to the Traveler and Paimon, who were passing by. If the willow roots were destroyed by the Root-Consuming Tumor, the information system would fail to function, and the visitor's senses would be affected.

To save the tree, Pahsiv and the Traveler needed to find three teardrop keys: on the foggy path in the south, at the spring in the north, and near the willow tree in the east. To obtain the key in the Foggy Forest, three drops of pure dew had to be returned to the glowing tree. The key near the willow was at the altar underwater. As the Traveler and Paimon searched for the final key in Loch Urania, they encountered a Bathysmal Vishap near an activated altar. They took it for danger and warned Pahsiv, but she only petted the Vishap, and he immediately calmed down. When the Vishap spat out the last key, Pahsiv explained that the filth had wounded the Vishap, but it continued to protect the key.

After all the keys were collected, the Traveler, Paimon, and Pahsiv went to the square near the Marcotte station, where there was a fountain with lion sculptures. When the Traveler placed the keys in the statues, a passage opened under the fountain leading to the roots of Erinnyes. To cleanse the roots of the weeping willow from filth, Pahsiv gave the Traveler part of her power, enhancing their abilities. As they fought with the filth, suddenly a magic circle lit up on the ground, from which the Rifthounds appeared. Pahsiv, who had been nearby all the time, suddenly disappeared, and in her place, a Vishap appeared and helped defeat the hounds. When the roots were cleared, the tree recovered and returned to its former appearance.
After saving Erinnyes, Pahsiv found treasure chests for Paimon and the Traveler as a token of gratitude, and in return, they promised to visit her, feed her with tidalga, teach her the language, and teach her how to say goodbye properly.

customize.name: Erinnyes Forest
customize.desc:
The winds blowing into the Court of Fontaine from the east are perfumed with a mysterious sweet scent.

In the depths of Erinnyes Forest where few dare to tread, the seed of adventure has been planted by the lakeside beneath the weeping willows.
